text: anyone have one of the new macbooks and have a keyboard issue? My j key is duplicating to two or three characters or I have to hit the key sometimes 9 times to get the jj to display
I don’t have one of those but you’re not alone - that keyboard has caused apple to get a lot of flack. I’d contact Apple they might replace the keyboard for you
every other week my spacebar goes dead for a while... there is nothing more infuriating.
thatwouldreallysuck…maybeuseitasanexcusetogetyourselfamechanicalkeyboard
it'snotthatbad,yougetusedtoit.justneedtomassagethebarforawhile and all of the suddentitgets a little better

lol could install a program to make it so you can use a different key as the space bar.

I realize that’s not a great solution but an okay temporary one
lmao, I usually use an external when at my desk, so it's really not a huge deal. Although, mapping "enter" to "unmute" for a few of our marketers could be great for next April Fools Day... lol

my boss just received a fax… it even looks as dated as their method of communication.
(it was spam)

just surprised people other than lawyers and medical people still do that
It’s still pretty commonplace in retail,medical,insurance
You know, industries that look into the gleaming future and say, “no”
haha. so you’re saying Phone book manufacturers
lol
When I bought my house I was scrambling to find someone to let me use their fax machine, stupid state wouldn't accept emailed documents

I bought my house just a few months ago - thankfully Wisconsin accepts e-signatures and e-forms.

Only once signed something in person on actual *shudder* paper.
I have a PNG version of my signature on my computer for dropping it into PDFs for signing
Physical signatures are such a funny thing to persist in the world today.  I'm also in the process of buying a house right now.
I just can't fathom the fact that drawing something on a piece of paper is the last step to make some of the most important things in your life official.
yeah, I was using my bluetooth keyboard yesterday when the j's needed 9 hits
Likewise, its makes it so much easier for things

when I bought my house in 2010, I signed over a 10" stack of papers. The pages where I signed were all bookmarked, so I didn't sign every page. It was a lot of signing. It was miserable. It was one long between the mortgage broker, my wife, and myself
e
